Morello]] | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Númenor]] | affiliation= | language=[[Adûnaic]], [[Sindarin]] and [[Quenya]] | birth={{SA|521}}{{UT|Kings}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death=unknown (aged 109+) | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house=[[House of Elros]] | parentage=[[Tar-Elendil]] | siblings=[[Isilmë]] and [[Tar-Meneldur]] | spouse=[[Elatan]] | children=[[Valandil (Lord of Andúnië)|Valandil]] | gender=Female | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Silmariën''' was the first child of the fourth [[King of Númenor]], [[Tar-Elendil]], and mother of the first [[Lords of Andúnië|Lord of Andúnië]]. ==History== Silmariën was the eldest child of King Tar-Elendil and elder sister of [[Meneldur]]. However, because of the [[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] law of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agnatic_primogeniture agnatic primogeniture] that then existed in the Realm, she could not succeed her father as King of Númenor, and instead her brother took up the [[Sceptre]] as [[Tar-Meneldur]].{{UT|Wife}} Silmariën wed [[Elatan]] of [[Andúnië]] and, in honor of their son [[Valandil (Lord of Andúnië)|Valandil]], her father created the royal title of [[Lords of Andúnië|Lord of Andúnië]]. Also, instead of giving this valuable heirloom to his heir, Tar-Elendil gave her the [[Ring of Barahir]].{{UT|Numenor}}, Note 2 Silmariën also was given a ''[[mithril]]'' [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fillet_(clothing) fillet].{{UT|Gladden}} ==Legacy== Her heirs, coming of the royal line of [[Númenor]],{{App|Numenor}} led the [[Faithful]] to [[Middle-earth]] to found the Kingdoms of [[Arnor]] and [[Gondor]] centuries later. [[Aragorn]], the hero of the [[War of the Ring]], is her direct descendant through ''many'' generations. Her fillet would become part of the [[Elendilmir]], a sign of royalty in [[Númenor]] and, later, the crown of the Kingdom of [[Arnor]]. ==Etymology== Silmariën's name is not given a translation, although its etymology is straightforward in [[Quenya]]. It may incorporate ''silma,'' "silver, shining white;{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry [[SIL]] crystal (white){{PE|17}}, p.23", and obviously ends in the feminine ending ''-rien'', apparently a variant of ''-ien'' (see ''-[[riel]]'').{{webcite|author=[[Helge Fauskanger]]|articleurl=http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.htm|articlename=Quettaparma Quenyallo|dated=December 25, 2008|website=Arda |accessed=}} The meaning therefore would be *"Maiden garlanded with shining light" ==Genealogy== {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | | | | | | | | | AMA | | | | | | | | |AMA=[[Tar-Amandil]]
